data.title: Melanie Martinez
data.meta_description: Melanie Adele Martinez is an American VMA-nominated singer-songwriter, screenwriter, poet, director, actress, dancer, producer, and photographer of Dominican and Puerto Rican descent. She first auditioned for the American television vocal talent show The Voice and became a member of Team Adam...
data.text:
Melanie Adele Martinez is an American VMA-nominated singer-songwriter, screenwriter, poet, director, actress, dancer, producer, and photographer of Dominican and Puerto Rican descent. She first auditioned for the American television vocal talent show The Voice and became a member of Team Adam, where her popularity rapidly grew among fans. Within the fifth week, she was eliminated, which subsequently prompted her to work on original material. She is also known for writing songs that discuss social issues.

Early life[]

Melanie was born in the Astoria neighborhood of Queens, New York, and raised in Baldwin, Long Island, New York. She stated that she "loved singing since she was really little" and that she taught herself how to play guitar at age 14 by looking up chord diagrams of songs that she liked and learning chord diagrams so that she could write original songs as well. She credits her love of poetry for leading her into songwriting.

She began uploading covers of songs such as "Follow Me" by Uncle Kracker, "How to Save a Life" by The Fray, and "Not a Second to Waste" by A Rocket to the Moon onto her YouTube channel in 2009, along with original songs such as "Go on Away" and "Smoke". The videos were mainly filmed by Melanie on her webcam.

Career[]

2012: Career beginnings and The Voice[]

Melanie Martinez appeared on season 3 of The Voice. She sang "Toxic" by Britney Spears for her Blind Audition and turned three chairs: Adam Levine, Ceelo Green, and Blake Shelton. Melanie chose Adam Levine as her coach and then moved on to the battle rounds. She competed against Caitlin Michele with the song "Lights" by Ellie Goulding. Adam chose Melanie, who moved on to the knockout rounds.

During the knockout rounds, Melanie was paired with Sam James, and they chose to sing "Bulletproof" by La Roux. Again, Adam chose her, who moved on to the live rounds. She chose to sing "Hit the Road Jack" by Ray Charles for the first week of the live rounds. The public vote did not save her, but Adam picked her to keep on his team. She went on to the second week of the live rounds, where she sang "Cough Syrup" by Young The Giant. This time, the public vote did save her, so she moved on to week three with "Seven Nation Army" by The White Stripes. "Seven Nation Army" was in the top ten on iTunes, so Martinez got her iTunes votes multiplied by ten. Martinez got to move on to the fourth week of the live rounds, where her song was "Too Close" by Alex Clare. Again, the song moved into the top ten on iTunes, so they had her iTunes votes multiplied by ten. Melanie then moved into week 5, which is the top 6.

Starting in week 5, singers of The Voice have to sing two songs, one picked by them and another picked by their coach. For those songs, Melanie picked "Crazy" by Gnarls Barkley, and Adam picked "The Show" by Lenka for her. Neither of her songs appeared in the top ten on iTunes, resulting in Melanie being eliminated.

2014-15: Dollhouse and American Horror Story[]

After being eliminated from the Top 6 on The Voice, Melanie began working independently on original material. Melanie released her single, "Dollhouse", on February 9, 2014, along with a music video. Two months later, on April 7, 2014, Melanie announced that she signed on Atlantic Records and that she would release an album and then go on tour. Later, she released her debut extended play (EP) Dollhouse on May 19, 2014, which included the singles Dollhouse and "Carousel", which later received a music video in October of that year. "Dead To Me" and "Bittersweet Tragedy" were also featured on the EP. The EP is mostly about a relationship that doesn't work out, excluding Dollhouse.

When the trailer for American Horror Story: Freak Show was released, Melanie's song, "Carousel", was featured in it, which helped the song rise in popularity. Melanie released the "Carousel" music video on October 15, 2014.

2015-2016: Cry Baby[]

Melanie released her debut album, Cry Baby, on August 14, 2015. It was made available to pre-order on July 24.

The lead single, "Pity Party", was released on June 1, 2015. The second single, "Soap", was released on July 10, 2015. The third single, "Sippy Cup", was released on July 31, 2015. Cry Baby was released on August 14, 2015, to critical acclaim.[1][2] The album debuted at number 6 on the Billboard 200. She released a special Christmas single, titled "Gingerbread Man" on December 23, 2015. Melanie said she planned on making music videos for every song on the standard edition of the album, all of which ended up being released by September 2017.

2016-2019: K-12 album and film[]

Melanie released her sophomore album, K-12, accompanied by a full-length film of the same name, on September 6, 2019. It had previously been made available for pre-order on July 23.

Melanie started recording the album in 2015 and finished in 2017, with producer Michael Keenan confirming that it was completed in January 2018. On April 13 and May 17, 2016, Melanie posted two different photos on Instagram, with lyrics in both captions. These songs, which were later revealed to be "High School Sweethearts" and "Lunchbox Friends" respectively, were confirmed to be on the album by Melanie herself, although she had stated then that the songs would not be released for a while.

In an interview in March 2017, Melanie confirmed that she would be working on a film to tell the story of her sophomore album. The film was described as a surrealist dark comedy musical.[3] Melanie worked on the hair, costumes, direction, and editing for the film. The movie was filmed in Europe, beginning in October and ending in December 2018.

On May 15, 2019, a teaser trailer was released, revealing the album and film's titles to be K-12. Within the next two weeks, she released two more teasers. Alongside the third teaser, she announced that both the album and film would be released on September 6, 2019.[4]

On June 17, 2019, a preview featuring clips of the movie and a snippet of a new song, later revealed to be "Nurse's Office", was premiered at the MTV Movie Awards. She began promoting the album with assignments starting on June 24, 2019. The film's official trailer was released along with the album track-list and pre-order on July 23, 2019. It was also announced that the film would be shown in theaters on September 5, a day prior to the film's official release. Melanie attended the film's premiere in Los Angeles, California, on September 3, 2019.

2020-2022: After School EP, and Billboard nomination[]

In an interview with V Magazine, Melanie stated that she would release songs that were in-line with K-12, but were "more personal and more vulnerable".

When the K-12 Tour began, fans began to speculate that Melanie would be releasing a new EP, possibly called After School, because the image displayed on the video screen during "Fire Drill" would show a pink composition notebook with the words "After School" written on the front.[5]

During the concert at O2 City Hall in Newcastle, Melanie announced that Fire Drill would be officially released at some point in 2020. It was later confirmed through Melanie's Instagram story that the song would be a track on her new extended play (EP), After School EP. On February 10, 2020, Melanie released a single from her After School EP titled "Copy Cat", featuring American rapper Tierra Whack. On June 26, 2020, Melanie released the second single from the After School EP, titled "Fire Drill", four months after its original release date. In October 2020, Melanie was nominated for Top Soundtrack for The Billboard Music Awards for her album and film K-12. This was her first big nomination in the music industry.

2023-present: PORTALS and VMA nomination[]

Melanie released her third studio album, PORTALS on March 31, 2023. The album's release was accompanied by a series of events and promotions, including snippets, egg hatching promotions and live performances of unreleased tracks. The lead single, "DEATH", released on March 17, 2023, followed by the second single, "VOID," on March 29, 2023, and the promotional single, "EVIL" on November 21, 2023. Melanie promptly released the album's deluxe edition, which featured the much-anticipated track "MILK OF THE SIREN". Melanie soon embarked on the PORTALS Tour on May 30, 2023.

On August 8, 2023, the music video for "VOID" was announced as a nominee for the Video Music Awards in the category for Best Visual Effects. It is her first major nomination and it lost to Taylor Swift's "Anti-Hero".

In March 2024, Melanie revealed that she has been in Hawaii writing new music.[6] She later said that she was starting the writing process for her next album, which she says that she will release "years from now". She plans to spend the rest of 2024 on The Trilogy Tour.[7]

Fanbase names[]

Little Bows

During Melanie's time on Season 3 of The Voice in 2012, she stated that her fans were called "Little Bows". She kept that name until she had been on the Dollhouse Tour for around 2 weeks, then switched to "Cry Baby" shortly after.

Crybabies/Cry Babies

Around June 2014, Melanie's fans started calling themselves "Cry Babies". Melanie has stated that she sees her fans as her friends instead of a fanbase who have a name, but she has accepted the name.[8]

Cherubs

Fans assumed that Melanie wanted to change the fanbase name to "Cherubs" during the K-12 era at some point, since she addressed them like that a few times, although she still mainly called her fans Crybabies.

Angel bbies

During the pre-PORTALS era, she addressed her fanbase as "Angel bbies", (which can be read as "Angel Babies"), on her Instagram occasionally.

Earthlings

Around the release of PORTALS, Melanie addressed her fanbase as "Earthlings" on Instagram posts[9]. Also, during the PORTALS Tour, she greeted her fans by calling them Earthlings. It's likely that this is the current fanbase name. As a result, many fans of Melanie have began calling themselves "Earthlings" instead of "Cry Babies" as of 2024.

Personal life[]

Melanie's earliest memory was her third birthday, when her parents hired a "sketchy" Barney for their birthday party. Due to how "sketchy" it was, she stated it was her "worst birthday party ever". She's been afraid of the dark ever since she was a child. Her hair is naturally brown, and she began experimenting with different colors when she was sixteen, after watching One Hundred and One Dalmatians and going off on her own to dye her hair like Cruella de Vil (despite not being allowed to).[10] Melanie only changes the color of the left side of her hair, always leaving the right side a solid black. Melanie's hair soon started to die, so she had to use wigs for a bit.

Melanie is known for being very shy. She is known to smoke marijuana to calm her nerves and reduce her anxiety before shows, although she has recently stopped smoking. She has also stated that she drinks occasionally.[11] She recently said that she found other alternatives to calm her anxiety.

On July 21, 2018, Melanie came out as bisexual through her Instagram story.[12] On January 20, 2021, Melanie confirmed that she uses the pronouns she/they.[12]

Relationships[]

Kenyon Parks

Melanie's earliest known boyfriend was Kenyon Parks, whom she encountered during her photography studies in 2011. They ended their relationship sometime between 2011 and 2012.

Vinnie DiCarlo

In 2012, Melanie started dating Vinnie DiCarlo. However, near late 2012, they broke up.

Jared Dylan

Subsequently. Melanie began dating Jared Dylan. During their time together, Jared wrote "Wicked Words" for Melanie to sing. Their relationship lasted until mid-2013. It is confirmed that "Alphabet Boy" was inspired by their relationship.

Edwin Zabala

In late 2013, Melanie entered into a romantic relationship with Edwin Zabala, who also played the role of Cry Baby's older brother in the "Dollhouse" music video. Unfortunately, their relationship ended on negative terms, and Edwin has been reported for leaking sexually explicit photos of Melanie to fans on the now-defunct video-chatting platform Omegle in 2014 after they split up.

Miles Nasta

Furthermore, in 2014, Melanie entered a romantic relationship with her drummer, Miles Nasta. Miles actively contributed to the creation of the song "Half Hearted" alongside Melanie. They remain close friends to this day.

Michael Keenan

In 2015, Melanie started dating Michael Keenan, her producer. They eventually broke up around 2017, but they remained close friends and continued to work together for her sophomore album, K-12.

Oliver Tree

After a long time, in 2019, Melanie revealed that she was dating Oliver Tree. They shared photos together, including a picture of them kissing, indicating their relationship. Melanie also dedicated the song "High School Sweethearts" to him on the K-12 Tour. However, in June 2020, rumors spread that they had broken up as they deleted photos and comments, and Melanie unfollowed Oliver on every social media account he had. On May 12, 2021, Melanie mentioned on her Instagram story that they had actually broken up a while ago but remained on good terms.

Justin Greenwood

During early 2022, there were rumors among fans that Melanie was dating Justin Greenwood (more commonly known as Verde), who is a singer, photographer, and music producer. The speculation arose from their frequent companionship and the affectionate terms they used for each other. According to Justin, they had been friends since seventh grade, and Melanie claims that he was her first kiss. On March 29, 2022, Melanie confirmed their relationship by posting a video on her Instagram story of them sharing a kiss by her pool.[13] He is still in a relationship with Melanie as of 2024.

Tattoos[]

Main article: Melanie Martinez/Tattoos

Hair colors[]

Main article: Melanie Martinez/Hair Colors

Discography[]

Main articles: Discography & Videography

Awards and nominations[]

Main article: Melanie Martinez/Awards and nominations

Controversies[]

In September-October of 2017, Melanie was called out for being accused of sexualizing babies as how she wore "sexy" baby clothes during the promotional photoshoot for Cry Baby. She later posted a response through Instagram, writing:

If you don't like pop surrealism you probably won't like me. If you can't understand that visual art has a deeper meaning and you only look at it for face value you probably won't get my work. If you can't understand that crybaby is a character, that the first record is representative of her childhood, and If you sexualize female pop artists on the daily you'll say I "sexualize babies." If you can't understand why someone would bring up mental health, growing pains from childhood to adolescence , family issues, and other uncomfortable topics we never hear about in pop music, you will probably just throw my music and art away as something that "glamorizes mental health issues" even though most of the people that resonate with my work deal with these things on a day to day and someone needs to be there for them. So here I am. If you have issues with my music and art and judge it so harshly to the point of making up your own reason as to what my intentions were when making it, you should just stop watching it. Because quite frankly, you. Just. Don't. Get. It.

Melanie Martinez, via[14]

In December of 2017, Melanie had been accused of rape by her ex-friend and possible former romantic interest, Timothy Heller.[15] Melanie later dropped a statement through Twitter denying the accusations:

I am horrified and saddened by the statements and story told tonight by Timothy Heller. What she and I shared was a close friendship for a period of time. We came into each other's lives as we were both starting our careers as artists, and we tried to help each other. We both had pain in dealing with our individual demons and the new paths we were forging, but I truly felt we were trying to lift each other up. She never said no to what we chose to do together. And although we parted ways, I am sending her love and light always.

Melanie Martinez

She then continued to tweet another response, denying the allegations.

I understand how hard it could be to see my side of the story, considering no one with a heart would want to invalidate anyone speaking up about this topic. I want to thank my fans who took the time to research the timeline, analyze past Instagram photos, and question the story being told, which reveal her false statements. I trusted so many people in my life who took advantage of that trust for their own personal gain. Please know that my intentions with everything that I do in my life are always pure and I would never be intimate with someone without their absolute consent.

Melanie Martinez, via[16]

Timothy then proceeded to deny either everything Melanie said.[17] Most fans of Melanie began throwing, burning, and destroying their merch after the allegation blew up. This issue led Melanie to release "PIGGYBACK".

After Timothy Heller accused Melanie of rape, Madeleine Carina came out with a similar story with less detail, claiming that Melanie had pressured her into having sex. However, Melanie has never publicly addressed the accusation.

In July 2024, Timothy posted a 6 minute video on Tiktok detailing how she had been harassed and bullied off the internet due to speaking up about the allegations. Melanie has not spoken up about this yet.

In January of 2022, Melanie released an NFT (non-fungible token) collection via MakersPlace. This caused people to be disappointed, as Melanie has always been against these types of topics, causing them to think she was standing against what she preached. Even though Melanie had made a statement that she did not mean to offend anyone by using NFTs, multiple people still disagreed with the action,[18][19] and some users pointed out that the platform uses Ethereum,[20] and any form of Ethereum blockchain was still harmful to the planet regardless of its modifications.[21]

On January 22, 2022, Melanie addressed this issue through her Instagram stories.[22][23][24][25][26] For more information, see here.

Gallery[]

To view the gallery of Melanie Martinez, click here.

Trivia[]

These songs were written out of Melanie's real-life experiences: "Cry Baby", "Carousel", "Alphabet Boy", "Soap", "Training Wheels", "Pity Party", "PIGGYBACK", "Wheels on the Bus", "The Principal", "Show & Tell", "Drama Club", "Strawberry Shortcake", "Lunchbox Friends", "Detention", "High School Sweethearts", "Recess", "Notebook", "Test Me", "Brain & Heart", "Numbers", "Glued", "Field Trip", "The Bakery", "VOID", "SPIDER WEB", "LIGHT SHOWER", "BATTLE OF THE LARYNX", "MOON CYCLE", "NYMPHOLOGY" and "EVIL".

These songs were fictionally written, or written out of experiences that Melanie did not personally go through: "Dollhouse", "Sippy Cup", "Tag, You're It", "Milk and Cookies", "Pacify Her", "Mrs. Potato Head", "Mad Hatter", "Class Fight", "Nurse's Office", "Orange Juice", "Teacher's Pet", "DEATH", "TUNNEL VISION", "FAERIE SOIRÉE", "LEECHES", "THE CONTORTIONIST" and "WOMB".

Melanie is bisexual.

Melanie tried to audition for American Idol when she was 15. However, she didn't make it past the first open call.[27]

Melanie's first kiss was with Verde, when they were in middle school. He is now her current partner.

Melanie has a Depop page called "toyangel" where she sells things, primarily jewelry. [28]

Melanie has said that she is terrible at painting nails.

At the age of 16, Melanie got the inspiration to dye her hair the way she does from Cruella De Vil.

Melanie's net worth is estimated to be around $9.77 million.

Melanie's height is 5'2", which is around 1.57 meters.

Melanie's zodiac sign is Taurus.

Melanie shared her astrology chart on Instagram.[29]

Melanie's first word was "mine."

When describing one of her tattoos, Melanie stated that she said it after her father had snatched her ice cream from her hand and she wanted it back.

When Melanie was younger, her favorite show was Ren & Stimpy.

Melanie's first celebrity crush was Dylan Sprouse.[30]

Melanie is of Puerto Rican and Dominican descent, although she doesn't know much Spanish.

Melanie's first pet was Whinnie, a pet rabbit.

Melanie currently has 3 pets named "Peanut", "Banana" and "Mochi" who are all French Bulldogs.

Melanie still has two baby teeth.

Melanie says she has really vivid dreams.

Melanie has stitches on her chin and hand.

Melanie is allergic to red apples.

Melanie hates vegetables.

Back in 2014-2016, Melanie claimed that she ate at least five chocolate chip cookies a day. She stopped in 2017 after going on a diet, stating that it was affecting her health in a bad way.

Melanie says that she always needs some sort of chocolate after every meal.

Melanie's old apartment looked like a baby nursery.

From 2016 to 2022, Melanie lived in a house with pastel-colored walls, displays all around of her old and vintage toys, and had a heart-shaped swimming pool.

Melanie's favorite holiday is Halloween.

Melanie's favorite milk flavor is chocolate.

Melanie is obsessed with American Horror Story.

Her favorite character from the show is Dandy.

Melanie has mentioned that she is a fan of the Netflix TV show Stranger Things.[31]

Her favorite character from the show is Eleven.

Melanie's favorite book is Go Ask Alice.[31]

Melanie's favorite movie is the 1988 film Alice, directed by Jan Švankmajer,[32] which also inspired the "Cry Baby" music video.[33]

Melanie's favorite Tim Burton film is Edward Scissorhands.[32]

Melanie's favorite visual artists are Mark Ryden and Nicoletta Ceccoli.

Melanie's favorite food is vegan Mac & Cheese.

Melanie's favorite color is pink.

Melanie loves amusement parks and roller coasters.

She has been to Disneyland a few times.

Melanie loves Play-Doh.

Melanie's lucky numbers are five and three.

The Angel Number, 222 is also very special to her, as she has a tattoo of it on her right bicep.

The Angel Number 222 means, "Right place, right time; trust in what you want; don't think of things you don't want."

The number 222 is always on top of their birthday cake as a candle.

It was also referenced as the classroom number on her debut film, K-12.

Melanie has 46 tattoos.

Her favorite tattoo is the one she got in honor of her deceased rabbit, Whinnie.

Melanie collects toys from the '50s and '60s.

She later sold a few of them in 2022 in order to have more budget for her second featured film and third album.

Melanie is obsessed with vintage Garbage Pail Kids cards, Animal Rummy cards, and Valentine's Day cards from the '50s.

Melanie claims to be really good at doing hair and makeup.

Melanie claims she can't really cook.

Melanie can shoot chocolate milk through the gap between her two front teeth.

She can also stick Swedish Fish in her gap.

Melanie's dad, Jose Martinez, goes on tours with her.

During the Dollhouse Tour, Melanie had three items stolen from her.

Melanie's pre-show ritual involves crying and fitting "a million" chocolate chip cookies into her mouth before getting on stage.

Melanie almost never performs with shoes on and tends to wear lacy socks; however, she has worn boots to perform at festivals.

When Melanie is alone, she blasts Muddy Waters' music and makes up dances to every song.

Melanie always loses her phone.

Melanie has stated that she stumbles or trips at least eight times a day.

Melanie's only fears are the dark and bees.

Melanie directs all of her music videos.

Melanie has called CJ Baran her favorite producer multiple times.

Melanie produced some of her old acoustic songs between 2009 and 2011 before becoming famous.

In the past, Melanie said that she didn't own a pair of jeans or sweatpants; however, this is no longer true.

Melanie has said that if she weren't a singer, she'd be a tattoo artist or a poet.

During the Crybaby era, Melanie often wore her custom-designed 'Crybaby' necklace and made a similar version of the necklace for sale so fans can have their own copies.

For a while, the necklace could not be found in the stock/catalog on her website, for unknown reasons.

Melanie previously owned a Vine account; however, she wasn't very active on it.

Melanie's favorite songs of her own are "Carousel", "Mrs. Potato Head", "Nurse's Office", "Test Me" and "VOID".

Melanie stated that the music video for "Mrs. Potato Head" was the hardest to film and write because she had to be careful not to portray a misunderstanding message on this song.

Melanie has said that she'd like to write a short story told through poetry.

Melanie thinks "Zipper" is a very cute word.

Melanie stated that she'd want to release a clothing line one day.

In an interview from September 2019, however, she instead stated that she would want to one day be a poet.[32]

In an October 2020 interview with Billboard, she stated that if she weren't a musician, she would be a designer, a photographer, a film maker, or a tarot card reader, as those are the only other things that she says she does.

Melanie wants to collaborate with The Weeknd.[34]

When asked what song by another artist she had wished she wrote, Melanie chose Teen Idle by MARINA, stating, "I think Marina's a brilliant songwriter. There's this one song she has called Teen Idle; it's just perfect. The lyrics are perfect. The melodies are insane."[30]

Melanie has donated to The Trevor Project, an LGBTQ+ suicide prevention non-profit organization.[35]

Her MBTI personality type is INFJ.

In a September 2020 Instagram post about After School EP, Melanie revealed that her mother was planning on naming her "Katarina", which means pure light, while she was in the womb, but then decided to name her "Melanie", which means darkness, and reminds her that "whatever imaginary box people put her in, she will always find a way out".

In the lyrics of "Field Trip", the line "Katarina in the womb for nine months, till she birthed me" can be found.

Melanie peels her cuticles when she is anxious. For example, she does so before concerts.

Melanie holds her nose whenever she swims underwater.

Melanie enjoys watching psychological thrillers, though she will become very nauseous if a movie is gore-heavy, as she is a highly sensitive person.

Melanie’s first introduction to dolls was when she watched the movie Chucky.

Melanie has stated in an interview that she is going to make 2 films after she made K-12.

Melanie loves vintage toys.

Melanie taught herself guitar and songwriting when she was around 13-14 years old.

When Melanie was 16, she bought a record player and multiple vinyl's of CocoRosie, Neutral Milk Hotel, Pasty Cline, and Fleet Foxes using her own money.

Melanie's first concert was Florence + The Machine.

Songs that make Melanie cry include “Lark” by Angel Olsen, “Love Ridden” by Fiona Apple, and “Like Someone in Love” by Bjork.

Movies that make her cry also include Up, Room, and Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind.

According to Melanie, describing her own genre would be called Heavy-Child.

The genre is present on her unreleased song, "Run", registered under its original file.

Her first fully self-produced and self-written songs that were officially released were "VOID" and "LIGHT SHOWER", both featured on her third studio album, PORTALS.

Melanie said if she were a piece of candy, she'd be bubble gum. [36]

Her favorite ice cream flavor is cookie dough.

In 2023, she stated that she is "kind of vegan". [37]

Her grandmother is the one who pushed her to sing.

It's difficult for her to write songs when she is happy.

She gets sick easily.
